intro: Luma stenophylla, commonly known as the yellow luma, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical rainforests of South America. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and clove. The plant is characterized by its small, oval leaves and clusters of fragrant yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of dense forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
